section.title: Sample Missions
section.para: The GMAT distribution includes more than 30 sample missions. These samples show how to apply GMAT to problems ranging from the Hohmann transfer to libration point station-keeping to trajectory optimization. To locate and run a sample mission:

listitem.para: Navigate to the samples folder located in the GMAT root directory.
Double-click a script file of your choice.

section.para: Some optimization missions require MATLAB, the MATLAB optimization toolbox, the VF13 optimizer, or the Yukon optimizer. Some of these are proprietary libraries and are not distributed with GMAT. For sample missions employing optimizers that are not available to you, you may try substituting the Yukon optimizer which comes with GMAT. The MATLAB fmincon optimizer currently only works with GMAT on the Windows platform. See for details on configuring the MATLAB optimizer.
